newsitem.title: INDIA: India CRISIL downgrades Flex Engineering to "A".
newsitem.headline: India CRISIL downgrades Flex Engineering to "A".

text.p: India's Credit Rating Information Services of India Ltd (CRISIL) on Wednesday downgraded the "AA-" rating it had assigned to the Non-Convertible Debenture programme of Flex Engineering Limited (FEL) to "A".
The firm said in a statement that the rating indicated adequate safety of timely payment of interest and principal.
The revised rating for FEL reflects CRISIL's concern at the deterioration of the company's financial structure, the statement said.

The original rating for a 500-million-rupee NCD took into account an equity infusion of 500 million rupees through a rights issue. But though the debt has come into the company, there has been no equity inflow.
This has affected the capital structure resulting in a deterioration in gearing (total debt/net worth) to 1.5 times on June 30.
"In view of declining operating margins coupled with increasing interest charges, the company's interest cover could be under pressure in future," the rating agency said.
